zone.line: expounding Homer; neither Metrodorus of Lamp
sacus, nor Stesimbrotus the Thasian, nor
Glaucon, nor any other existing rhapsodist
of the present time, can give [discourse]
so variously & beautifully respecting the
[meaning] give so many various &
beautiful meanings to the verses of Homer as
I can--. Socrates. I am persuaded of
your eminent skill, o Ion. You will not
grudge me a proof & explanation?
Ion. It is worth your while to hear how
I have adorned the manner in which I
the hidden beauties
illustrated [?of][?from]
have added adorned Homer, [revealing] his
hidden beauties: I deserve a golden crown
from his descendants{.--} Soc. And I will
[?make] find leisure some day or other
to request you to give me a specimen
of this art; at present [?pres] I will
only trouble you with one question.--
Are you only powerful in excellent
alone
alone in explaining Homer, or are
you conscious of the same power
